intro: Henriettea caudata, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It possesses small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually green and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Henriettea caudata is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host trees.
